Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below (mostly worn); part of floral pattern in added white outline with traces of added red; exterior, from top: billet pattern around rim; double guilloche band between pairs of lines; dot and billet band; below, on left, part of vertical dividing band with dot between pairs of verticals; at right, part of corner pendant roundel and dotted circle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The double guilloche pattern below the rim is not frequently found in the Wild Goat or Mature Animal Style. The metopal pattern is typically found in the Wild Goat Style, but disappears in the Mature Animal Style, although the interior decoration, whilst almost entirely worn, is not typical of the Wild Goat Style and may represent a transition from that style to the Mature Animal Style. For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.500.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 262, no. 530)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0387) (phase 2)
